definitions.definition: an area of darkness, caused by light being blocked by something:
examples: The children were playing, jumping on each other's shadows.

definitions.definition: an area of darkness in which people and things cannot be seen:
examples: Someone jumped out of the shadows and grabbed my handbag.

definitions.definition: a small dark area of skin under your eye:
examples: She put on some make-up to cover the dark shadows under her eyes.

definitions.definition: to be very close to a larger building or place:
examples: His workshop was in the shadow of the great church of San Paolo Maggiore.

definitions.definition: to be in a situation in which something unpleasant either seems likely to happen and to have a bad effect on your life, or is already having a bad effect on your life:
examples: We are all living under the shadow of war.
The police think that the robbers shadowed their victims for days before the crime.

definitions.definition: to follow someone else while they are at work in order to learn about that person's job:
examples: Your first week in the job will be spent shadowing one of our more experienced employees.
